item.title: NCSOFT open-world MMO tactical shooter Project LLL officially titled CINDER CITY
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Official website and social accounts launched.

Project LLL, the new “massively multiplayer online tactical shooter” currently in development for consoles and PC from publisher NCSOFT and development subsidiary BigFire Games, will be officially titled CINDER CITY, the companies announced.

CINDER CITY will feature dynamic graphics built on Unreal Engine 5 and a “seamless” open world. The game is a history-altering science fiction story where 23rd century future technology coexists with the 21st century present. Set in a “devastated futuristic Seoul” modeled after actual districts like Samseong-dong and Nonhyeon-dong, it promises realistic combat mechanics that reflect firearm operating principles.

NCSOFT also launched an official website, Twitter account, Facebook page, and YouTube channel for the game.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/ncsoft-open-world-mmo-tactical-shooter-project-lll-officially-titled-cinder-city

item.title: Telenet RPG Collection announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out on November 27 in Japan.

Edia has announced Telenet RPG Collection for Switch, which will include ports of three role-playing games originally developed and released by Telenet Japan. It will launch on November 27 in Japan for 6,800 yen (7,480 yen with tax).

The collection will feature the following three titles:

  • Dark Kingdom (1994, Super Famicom)
  • Hiouden: Mamono-tachi tono Chikai (1994, Super Famicom)
  • The Journey Home: Quest for the Throne (1993, Super Famicom)

In addition to the standard edition, a special edition will also be available for 9,800 yen (10,780 yen with tax), which includes a soundtrack CD and the official fan book “Telenet RPG Fan Book” (B6-size, 48 pages).

Watch the announcement trailer below. Visit the official website here.

Announce Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/telenet-rpg-collection-announced-for-switch

item.title: BrokenLore: LOW coming to PS5, Xbox Series on September 15
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for PC.

Serafini Productions will release first-person horror game BrokenLore: LOW for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on September 15, the developer announced.

BrokenLore: LOW first launched for PC via Steam on February 20.

Here is an overview of the game, via Serafini Productions:

About

BrokenLore: LOW takes players on a journey filled with tension, mystery, and the supernatural, where every corner of the mist hides forgotten truths and unfathomable horrors.

Set in a remote Japanese village, Kirisame Mura (Village of the Mist), this first-person horror game delves into the dark prelude of the story narrated in BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW.

Game Objectives

  • Reveal the Roots of Deep-Seated Hatred.
  • Explore the circular, claustrophobic pathway structure of Kirisame Mura.
  • Introduce the Game Loop Structure, symbolizing the unstoppable cycle of tragic events.

Story

Naomi Montgomery arrives at Kirisame Mura for a professional opportunity that promises to launch her music career but instead finds herself facing sinister presences and the cursed secrets of the village. Her story is a journey through time and memory, laying the groundwork for the events narrated in BrokenLore: UNFOLLOW.

The aura of mystery surrounding the village intensifies with the gradual revelation of a dark legend that haunts the town. The legend tells that, at the center of the village, there was an ancient temple, now disappeared, the scene of a tragedy that has cursed all its inhabitants.

Gameplay Mechanics

  • Sinister manifestations suggest ancient forces keeping watch over the village.
  • Survival requires players to hide from enemies instead of confronting them directly.
  • Discovering diaries and letters provides historical and emotional context.
  • Lost stories are unveiled as players navigate through the village’s winding paths.

Village Themes

Kirisame Mura is designed to be an enigma in itself, a labyrinth with no exit that symbolizes the cycle of wrong decisions and broken destinies of the protagonist. The game’s structure emphasizes this aspect with an environment that subtly repeats and changes, challenging players to find a way to break the cycle as they delve into the story. Themes of envy, ambition, and failure will be explored.

Watch a new trailer below.

PlayStation 5 Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/brokenlore-low-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-on-september-15

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A ‘Z-A Battle Club’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

Defeat as many of each other's Pokemon as possible within the time limit.

Publisher The Pokemon Company and developer Game Freak have released a new trailer for Pokemon Legends: Z-A introducing the Z-A Battle Club.

The trailer description reads, “The Z-A Battle Club is ready for its newest Link Battle entrants! Up to four players can take part in battles where they attempt to defeat as many of each other’s Pokemon as they can within the time limit. Make full use of a variety of moves and Mega Evolutions and go on the offensive!​”

Pokemon Legends: Z-A is due out for Switch 2 and Switch on October 16.

Watch the trailer below.

Z-A Battle Club Trailer

English

Japanese



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/pokemon-legends-z-a-z-a-battle-club-trailer

item.title: Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket adds Mega Evolution this fall
item.content:encoded:
• Smartphone

First looks at Mega Altaria, Mega Gyarados, and Mega Blaziken.

Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket will add Mega Evolution alongside the start of a new season this fall, The Pokemon Company announced.

A new trailer features first looks at Mega Altaria, Mega Gyarados, and Mega Blaziken.

Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket is available now for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play.

Watch the trailer below.

Mega Evolution Announce Trailer

English

Japanese



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/08/pokemon-trading-card-game-pocket-adds-mega-evolution-this-fall
